terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Belgian Ardennes. Significant elevation with forest scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Belgian event. Hilly Ardennes terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Houffa Gravel is a regional event in Houffalize, Belgian Ardennes‚Äîhilly terrain with significant elevation. The Ardennes forest is scenic, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. Houffalize provides good access.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional Belgian gravel race with hilly Ardennes terrain. Worth it for Belgian/European cyclists. Not a destination race for international travelers.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Belgium/Europe and want a local event‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're international‚Äîthere are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Belgian events: Ardenne Gravel Stages. For similar regional events: other Belgian gravel races.

logistics.food: Houffalize has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: Belgian Ardennes hills require sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: Starting from Houffalize's main square keeps things simple, with Friday packet pickup available. Mads W√ºrtz Schmidt noted "a short technical and bumpy section" at 25km where gaps form, showing the course creates natural selection points that work tactically. The 1850-rider field size demonstrates competent crowd management in a small Ardennes town.

length.explanation: Ben Thomas described how "The first lap was savage, I clung to the leaders until five of them edged away" before being swept into a twenty-rider group. Three 47km laps create tactical depth where early aggression gets punished - Thomas noted "I was paying for all the work I'd done in the first two laps" when fresh legs attacked on lap three. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: The 2025 redesign specifically included "fewer technical downhills but was still challenging," suggesting the original version wasn't pushing limits. Ben Thomas mentioned "rocky singletrack" sections, but his confidence that "my descending was on fire" with 55mm tires and a suspension fork indicates manageable technical demands for prepared riders. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The C√¥te du Saint Roch hits immediately with 506 watts needed "for just over 3 minutes to crest the 0.8km hill with an average gradient of 12.4%." Ben Thomas noted the race "is already in bits" after this opening climb. 700m per lap totaling 2,100m creates cumulative damage through rolling Ardennes terrain. Similar elevation profile to Gravel Worlds.

climate.explanation: Late August in the Belgian Ardennes means you avoid the spring mud season and summer heat waves that can destroy European races. Weather's typically cooperative without being boring, and you're not dealing with altitude or extreme temperature swings. The research lacks specific weather horror stories, which in Belgium usually means conditions stay rideable rather than epic. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: This is the Belgian Ardennes, not the Alps. You're talking rolling hills and river valleys where the biggest physiological challenge is lactate buildup, not oxygen debt. Sea level fitness translates directly with zero acclimatization concerns. If altitude is part of your race selection criteria, you're looking at the wrong continent. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: You're racing through established cycling tourism territory in a well-developed European region, not discovering hidden gravel gems. The Ardennes have cycling history, but this feels more like a workout with UCI credentials than a true adventure into unknown terrain. Three laps of the same 47km circuit means you've seen everything by the end of lap one.

prestige.explanation: Mads W√ºrtz Schmidt's win and quote "Back to the winning ways on the trails. I love The Ardennes in Belgium" shows elite rider appreciation. The 2026 European Championships hosting rights and UCI World Series status provide credibility, but this remains a five-year-old regional qualifier rather than destination racing.

race_quality.explanation: Schmidt's race-winning move came from a technical section gap: "Coming out of the section I looked back and saw a gap of 50-70 meters. Decided to put my head down and go for it." The course creates opportunities for decisive moves, though the redesign to reduce technical difficulty suggests organizers prioritized accessibility over challenge.

experience.explanation: Three 47km laps with 700m elevation each gives you a proper suffer-fest structure, and starting from Houffalize's main square has that European town charm. The immediate Rue du Saint Roch climb separates pretenders from contenders right away. You get your qualifier status if you're in the top 25%, which feels achievable without being handed to you.

community.explanation: Belgian cycling culture runs deep, and Houffalize has MTB World Cup heritage that carries over to the gravel scene. Being part of the Bolero Gravel Series creates a season-long community of riders chasing qualifiers together. The Friday packet pickup and small-town logistics force riders to actually interact rather than disappear into massive expo anonymity.

field_depth.explanation: It's a regional qualifier that happens to have UCI backing, not a destination race that pulls international talent. The top 25% qualification rate suggests they're not drowning in elite depth - compare that to races where making the top 10% is an achievement. No mention of notable winners or standout performances means you're racing weekend warriors with good engines, not future world champions. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Ben Thomas puts it: "By lap three all the people who'd saved their energy and still had fresh legs came to the front and whacked it on the front! The pace went nuclear."

value.explanation: Top 25% qualification for UCI Gravel World Championships, plus 2026 European Championships course preview, multiple distance options, and access to elite fields including Van Aert appearances. The Belgian setting provides authentic cycling culture with "legendary climbs" and traditional Ardennes racing atmosphere.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨60-100. Belgium in August means peak tourist season pricing in a region that caters to cycling tourism year-round. No specific airport mentioned, but you're looking at Brussels or maybe Luxembourg connections, then ground transport to the Ardennes. Houffalize isn't overflowing with budget accommodations, and being a mountain bike capital means everything's priced for cycling tourists with money. Higher total cost than Badlands.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: Houffa Gravel - UCI Gravel World Series // First 12.5km Onboard Footage
videos.description:
110km/68.3mi Gravel Race
UCI Gravel World Series - World Championship Qualifier
Houffalize, Belgium

My Patreon: http://patreon.com/justinmcquerry/    
Race Info: https://houffagravelfondo.be/en/

Bike - Ibis Hakka: http://ibiscycles.com/bikes/hakka-mx
Tools & Tubeless Plugs - Prestacycle: https://prestacycle.com
Frame Bags - MoosePacks: http://moosepacks.com/
Ti Bolts and Axles: http://metireggioemilia.it/
Wheels - BERD: http://berdspokes.com/
Tires - Maxxis: https://www.maxxis.com/us/tires/bicycle/
Glasses - Julbo Eyewear: https://julbo.us
Bibs - Assos: https://www.assos.com/us/

Follow me at:

http://instagram.com/j_mcquerry/

http://facebook.com/justin.mcquerry/
videos.curation_reason: High-quality onboard race footage from a World Championship qualifier with good production value and viewership.

videos.title: Houffalize UCI World Gravel Series - Road To The World Championships
videos.description:
A few weeks ago I took part in my second ever gravel race at the world series in Belgium. In this video I show you all the travel and behind the scene in my prep for this race. A super difficult course with all types of riding conditions made for a hard race nearly 5 hours in duration. 

Make sure to like and subscribe.

Make sure to follow me on.... 
Instagram - _jackreed_
https://www.instagram.com/_jackreed__/ 
Strava - Jack Reed
https://www.strava.com/athletes/11433098
Facebook - Jack Reed Cycling 
https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100087131044838 
Twitter - _jackreed__
https://twitter.com/_jackreed_

Many thanks to my sponsors....
BDO Limited 
https://www.bdo.gg/en-gb/home 
Guernsey Sports Commission
https://guernseysports.com/ 
Pedal Potential 
http://www.pedalpotential.co.uk/ 

What I am doing this year wouldn't be possible without them

#cyclingvlog #athlete #RIFS4 #cyclinglife #cycling #bikelife #lifeonwheels #lifeinthepeloton #eliteracing #newvideo #2025 #bikes #dayinthelife #newvideo  #athleteexercise #france #bikerace #gravelbike #gravelrace #worldchampionship #houffalize #belgium #spiritofgravel

Gallock, which is the main thing. Um,

I'll do an outro for the video maybe
when I'm back in Britany. But I'm going
to sleep well tonight. Uh, and I'm just
going to chill out here for the rest of
the day now. Um, as I'm pretty cooked.

videos.title: UCI Houffa Gravel 2025 DNF (2 Laps Uncut)
videos.description:
üåç Houffa Gravel 2025 ‚Äì Ardennes Tech Ride | Houffalize üáßüá™

This was my ride at Houffa Gravel: a technical Ardennes classic packed with steep climbs, fast descents, and tricky singletrack. I didn‚Äôt finish (DNF) after 2 of the 3 laps‚Äîbut I still enjoyed the ride and learned a lot.

üìç Route:
Houffalize (start/finish) ‚Üí Tavigny ‚Üí Brisy ‚Üí Cherain ‚Üí Steinbach ‚Üí back to Houffalize
‚Äì 140 km total (3 laps)
‚Äì Highest point: 600 m
‚Äì Lowest point: 320 m
‚Äì Mix of singletrack, gravel, and asphalt

üìÖ Date: August 30, 2025
üìè Distance: 96.7 km (2 laps completed)
‚õ∞Ô∏è Elevation Gain: 1,938 m
‚è±Ô∏è Moving Time: 4h 06m
‚ö° Includes: Power, heart rate, GPS tracking

üîó Strava ride: https://www.strava.com/activities/15636034329

‚∏ª

What happened during the ride:
- Back issues: around 35 km I started feeling my back again. I eased off, it got better, but the warning signs stayed.
- Family check-in: mid-ride I got some texts from home not everything was going as planned there with the kids...
- Decision: after 2 laps I called it a day. The fun was there, the lessons too. 

Next stop: UCI Gravel World Championship in Limburg!! 

‚∏ª

Tire setup for this ride:
- Rear: Schwalbe R-Pro 45 mm
- Front: Schwalbe Thunder Burt 2.1‚Äù (53 mm)

‚∏ª

Key takeaways for UCI Gravel World Championship prep:
- Drop some weight
- Build core strength
- Regain focus & rhythm
- Add strength training
- Recon the course

‚∏ª

üéûÔ∏è Highlights edit coming soon‚Äîwith full-speed Ardennes descents!

üì∫ Unlocked by Tim
I ride to explore, to push, to connect.
What the road reveals, the ride teaches.

Drop a comment if you‚Äôve ever consciously decided not to finish a race. ‚úåÔ∏è

#HouffaGravel #ArdennesGravel #UnlockedByTim #GravelRacing #UCIGravel #DNF #LearningCurve
videos.curation_reason: Extensive uncut race footage showing two full laps of the challenging Ardennes course with technical terrain details.

videos.title: Houffa Gravel 2023
videos.description: Houffa Gravel in Houffalize Belgium. My first Gravel race. It went quite ok for that. It was part of the UCI Gravel World Series. I got 49th in my age group and did therefore not qualify for world champs that year.
